metadata.title: CVE-2021-4048 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-preview 22.04 LTS (jammy) - low
metadata.description:
An out-of-bounds read flaw was found in the CLARRV, DLARRV, SLARRV, andZLARRV functions in lapack through version 3.10.0, as also used in OpenBLASbefore version 0.3.18. Specially crafted inputs passed to these functionscould cause an application using lapack to crash or possibly discloseportions of its memory.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-4048` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libblas-test - 3.10.0-2ubuntu1
libblas3 - 3.10.0-2ubuntu1
libblas64-3 - 3.10.0-2ubuntu1
libblas64-test - 3.10.0-2ubuntu1
liblapack-pic - 3.10.0-2ubuntu1
liblapack-test - 3.10.0-2ubuntu1
liblapack3 - 3.10.0-2ubuntu1
liblapack64-3 - 3.10.0-2ubuntu1
liblapack64-test - 3.10.0-2ubuntu1
liblapacke - 3.10.0-2ubuntu1
liblapacke64 - 3.10.0-2ubuntu1
libtmglib3 - 3.10.0-2ubuntu1
libtmglib64-3 - 3.10.0-2ubuntu1
No subscription required

libjulia-openblas64 - 0.3.18+ds-2
libopenblas-base - 0.3.18+ds-2
libopenblas0 - 0.3.18+ds-2
libopenblas0-openmp - 0.3.18+ds-2
libopenblas0-pthread - 0.3.18+ds-2
libopenblas0-serial - 0.3.18+ds-2
libopenblas64-0 - 0.3.18+ds-2
libopenblas64-0-openmp - 0.3.18+ds-2
libopenblas64-0-pthread - 0.3.18+ds-2
libopenblas64-0-serial - 0.3.18+ds-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: lapack package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.10.0-2ubuntu1').
openblas package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.3.18+ds-2').
